projectGridLines.title: Project 1  Title: Augmentation of Public Revenue ,Project 2  Title: Financial Analytics Unit & Project 3  Title: Effective Capital Budgeting
projectGridLines.description:
Project 1

Title: Augmentation of Public Revenue 

Description: The project involves working with revenue earning department such as Registration, Revenue Division of Municipal Corporations to understand the current state of revenue collection from major sources such as Stamp Duty and Registration Fees, Property Taxes etc. With States at the forefront of driving development and reforms along with introduction of GST, the autonomy of states with respect to state owned taxes have gain importance. However, infrequent revisions to tax rates along with inability of the current systems to capture true market value of properties have dampened revenue collection. CEGIS team is collaborating with the concerned revenue departments and former Chief Economic Advisor to the Government of India to suggest and implement long-term system-based reforms to optimize revenue collection. 

Skill sets: Interest in Finance / Economics, Data structuring, Advanced MS Excel / R / Stata, 

Traits expectation: Willingness to collaborate on Government-based projects, self-initiator, 

Expected learning: Understanding of Public Finance particularly design and administration of state taxes, working with disparate datasets, structuring, and analysis of large datasets

Specific courses required for project execution:  Nothing in particular 

Project 2

Title: Financial Analytics Unit

Description: CEGIS is supporting the Finance Department, Government of Tamil Nadu in setting up a dedicated Financial Analytics Unit (FAU), to improve decisions around budgeting and the quality of public expenditure. Such a dedicated unit within the Finance Department is unprecedented and is aimed at institutionalizing decision making pertaining to revenue and expenditure areas in the State. 

Skill sets: Interest in Finance / Economics, Data structuring, Skilled in advanced MS Excel / R / Stata, Understanding of Public Policy, Literature review 

Traits expectation: Willingness to collaborate on Government-based projects, self-initiator,

Expected learning: Understanding of Government decision making with respect to revenue and expenditure, working with disparate datasets, structuring, and analysis of large datasets

Specific courses required for project execution: Nothing in particular

Project 3

Title: Effective Capital Budgeting 

Description: This project involves improving the structure and process of capital budgeting in the State. Tami; Nadu spends about INR 45,000 crore annually on capital expenditure that covers infrastructure such as roads, bridges, buildings, water treatment plants etc. to name a few. However, about 20% of the budgeted capital expenditure is surrendered by administrative departments. Further, some departments seek additional funding requirements for capital expenditure. The project is currently supporting the Finance Department in creating visibility of infrastructure stock across departments in the state along with identification of norms and/or objective metrics for new asset creation so that there is a more equitable distribution of scare state funds on both inter-department and intra-department needs. This project is likely to inform the Medium-Term Expenditure Framework of the State. 

Skill sets: Literature review, qualitative and quantitative analysis, basic MS Excel ,and PowerPoint. 

Traits expectation: Willingness to collaborate on Government-based projects, self-initiator,

Expected learning: Good understanding of government budgets particularly capital budgeting, Nuances of decision making around infrastructure creation

Specific courses required for project execution: Nothing in particular.
